attributes.action: Award Mick McGeogh an OBE for services to Welsh Athletics
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Mick McGeogh is one of the most respected, admired and inspirational figures in Welsh Athletics. In addition to pursuing his own outstanding athletics career spanning 5 decades (which shows no sign of letting-up) he has selflessly and tirelessly worked behind the scenes to motivate and encourage others to actively support and participate in the sport of running in all its various forms and at all levels. 

Although far too modest to admit it, Mick is also the ‘The Rock’ of Les Croupiers Running Club (the largest in Wales ?) and has inspired and helped hundreds in the South East Wales area to take up an stick with the sport regardless of ability or outcome.  He also founded and supports the remarkable annual Barry 40 race, one of the most important events in the ultra-distance running calendar and promoted the 210 mile Welsh Castles Relay Race, one of the most admired and complex events of its kind in the UK.
